law.catch_line: Title to rights-of-way and records of discontinued roads to be filed in county clerk's office.

text.section: The county road engineer shall turn over to the county clerk all documents of title to all rights-of-way, whether acquired by gift or condemnation, and all documents relating to discontinuations of public roads, including maps, plats and surveys.
The county clerk shall keep on convenient file or in books prepared for that purpose a complete record of all such documents.

law.history: Recodified 1942 Ky. Acts ch. 208, sec. 1, effective October 1, 1942, from Ky. Stat. secs. 4297, 4321.
